вариант фруктов [guo3]
rtega_mnemonic:
菓菓RSfruits, nuts, berries, cookie, candy
  • made from fruit 果 and things resembling grass 艹 (sugar cane)
heisig_constituent: candy, flowers, fruit, rice field, brains, tree, wood
koohiiStory1: This candy is made in the shape of a flower, each petal with the taste of a different fruit.
koohiiStory2: Candy is coloured like flowers and flavoured like fruit.
jp_example_words:
菓子(かし): pastry
お菓子(おかし): confections, sweets, candy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You take some flowers and some fruit and you make a cake out of it. It’s a very nice looking, flavorful cake. The fruit makes it taste great and the flowers make for great cake decorations.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at this cake you have made. It’s majestic. Now taste some of it. It is one great tasting cake. Imagine yourself eating the best cake in all of ever.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You’re standing back, admiring your cake when you hear a car (か) engine revving and before you know it your cake has been run over. The car came out of nowhere and ran your cake right over, spraying fruit cake bits and flowers all over the place. Stupid car!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hear the roar of the car engine as you get splattered in the face with the cake. Wipe it off of your face just in time to see the car speeding off into the distance. Also, recall that this kanji shares a reading with the similar kanji, 果.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the result (果) of the grass (艹) is candy

菓字的基本解释

菓
guǒ
同“果”①。

菓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［guǒ］
［《廣韻》古火切，上果，見。］
同“果1”。
果实。

菓字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　菓； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1037第29
【唐韻】古火切，音裹。木實。本作果，《漢書》作菓。【史記·叔孫通傳】古者有春嘗菓，方今櫻桃熟可獻。

果实。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Jian Zi] 　果; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1037 29
[Tang Yun] Ancient fire cut, sound wrapped. Mushi. This is the fruit, and the "Han Shu" is the fruit. [Historical Records · Shu Sun Tong Chuan] The ancients had spring to taste the fruit, and now the cherries are ripe and can be offered.

guǒ
вм. 果 (фрукт, плод)
Radicals: 艹, 果  (flowers, fruit)
Meaning Mnemonic
You take some flowers and some fruit and you make a cake out of it. It’s a very nice looking, flavorful cake. The fruit makes it taste great and the flowers make for great cake decorations.
Look at this cake you have made. It’s majestic. Now taste some of it. It is one great tasting cake. Imagine yourself eating the best cake in all of ever.
Reading Mnemonic
You’re standing back, admiring your cake when you hear a car (か) engine revving and before you know it your cake has been run over. The car came out of nowhere and ran your cake right over, spraying fruit cake bits and flowers all over the place. Stupid car!
Hear the roar of the car engine as you get splattered in the face with the cake. Wipe it off of your face just in time to see the car speeding off into the distance. Also, recall that this kanji shares a reading with the similar kanji, 果.
